basics.name: Junzhi Ning
basics.label: Master Student
basics.summary: A  Man in Quest of the unknown, yet satisfied.

work.name: Institute for Advanced Study, Princeton University
work.summary: Teaching at Palmer Physical Laboratory (now 302 Frist Campus Center). While not a professor at Princeton, I associated with the physics professors and continued to give lectures on campus.

volunteer.summary: Lead organizer for the New York City branch of the People's Climate March, the largest climate march in history.
highlights: Awarded 'Climate Hero' award by Greenpeace for my efforts organizing the march.
Men of the year 2014 by Time magazine

awards.title: University Medal
awards.summary: Awarded the University Medal for outstanding academic performance in Data Science.

projects.name: UNVEILING THE CAPABILITIES OF LATENT DIFFUSION MODELS FOR CLASSIFICATION OF LUNG DISEASES IN CHEST X-RAYS
projects.summary: This project employs latent conditional diffusion models to classify lung diseases in Chest X-Rays (CXR) by utilizing noise estimation errors for accurate prediction.

projects.name: ARMUT-LOR: Adaptive Region-aware Masked Unpaired Translation for Lung Opacity Removal in Chest X-rays
projects.summary: Developed a framework for unpaired translation of CXRs with lung opacities, using adaptive activation masks to improve lung border segmentation and lesion detection.

publications.name: UNVEILING THE CAPABILITIES OF LATENT DIFFUSION MODELS FOR CLASSIFICATION OF LUNG DISEASES IN CHEST X-RAYS
publications.summary: This paper explores the use of latent diffusion models for lung disease classification in CXRs, focusing on noise estimations to determine disease probabilities.

publications.name: ARMUT-LOR: Adaptive Region-aware Masked Unpaired Translation for Lung Opacity Removal in Chest X-rays
publications.summary: The thesis proposes a novel unpaired translation framework to improve lung opacity diagnosis in CXRs.
